meanings.definition: A small wooden or metal peg used to stop a cask or barrel.
meanings.sent1: The spile kept the barrel tightly sealed.
meanings.sent2: Please remove the spile carefully to access the contents of the cask.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the spile for a nut and tried to bury it.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a spile, holding back her emotions until she was ready to share.
meanings.sent5: The old spile, weathered and worn, still served its purpose faithfully.

meanings.definition: To tap or draw off (liquid) by means of a spile.
meanings.sent1: He had to spile the maple tree to collect sap for syrup.
meanings.sent2: The workers will spile the keg to release the beer for the party.
meanings.sent3: She tried to spile the water from the hose, but it sprayed everywhere.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to spile out uncontrollably, revealing his true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The magician seemed to spile magic from his fingertips, mesmerizing the audience.

meanings.definition: A spout or pipe for conducting liquid.
meanings.sent1: The spile on the fountain was clogged, causing the water to trickle slowly.
meanings.sent2: The old well had a rusty spile that directed water into the bucket.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pretended the spile was a telescope, looking out into the yard.
meanings.sent4: The spile of knowledge flowed freely from the wise elder's lips.
meanings.sent5: The golden spile gleamed in the sunlight, guiding travelers to the fresh spring.
